bibl.title: Tsunetaro Machida v. Henry M. White. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District court of the United States, Western District of Washington - Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Tsunetaro Machida for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

This cause coming on to be heard upon the application of the petitioner, Tsunetaro Machida for a writ of habeas corpus, or for an order directed to Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, to show cause, if any he can, why the petitioner be not discharged forthwith if any he can, why the petitioner be not discharged forthwith for the alleged unlawful imprisonment and detention of him as set forth in his petition. And the court being well and sufficiently advised in the premises, it is hereby

CONSIDERED, ORDERED and ADJUDGED that Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration as aforesaid, be and appear on the 4th day of September, A.D. 1921, at the hour of 10:00 A.M. before this court sitting in Seattle, Washington, to show cause, if any he can, why the petitioner's prayer not be granted, and he be restored to his liberty.
Until further order of the court, the deportation of petitioner is stayed and he will be released upon the giving of approved security in the amount of Seven Hundred, Fifty Dollars.
DATED, at Tacoma, Washington, this 28th day of July, A.D. 1921.
Filed in the United States District Court
